A limited beta began on June 23, open only to 75,000 US, Israel & Brazil customers, with a Chinese beta opening in mid July, however, only one day later, (June 24, 2009), the downloads are no longer accessible, and the website displays a message saying "We are not accepting additional participants at this time"<ref>http://www.microsoft.com/security_essentials/</ref>. Amy Barzdukas, senior director of product management in the online services division at Microsoft, said: "This new, no-cost offering will give us the ability to protect an even greater number of consumers, especially in markets where the growth of new PC purchases is outpaced only by the growth of malware." <ref name="nocostsecuritypr" />
  +   +
==History==
Morro's announcement, made on Tuesday, November 18, 2008, marked a change in Microsoft's PC security strategy. [[Windows Live OneCare]], the all-in-one service that Microsoft launched in May 2006, only managed to take 2% of the already clustered PC security market.<ref>{{cite news
Morro's announcement, made on Tuesday, November 18, 2008, marked a change in Microsoft's PC security strategy. [[Windows Live OneCare]], the all-in-one service that Microsoft launched in May 2006, only managed to take 2% of the already clustered PC security market.<ref>{{cite news
| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/7737520.stm
| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/7737520.stm
Line 41: Line 43:
}}</ref> OneCare will be discontinued in June 2009 as a part of the announcement.
}}</ref> OneCare will be discontinued in June 2009 as a part of the announcement.
  +
==Features==
MSE is based on OneCare's technologies, essentially making it OneCare without the management features and other non-anti-malware functionality, albeit greatly streamlined and simplified. In addition, MSE has been optimized to run on low end hardware efficiently, such as a Celeron-based [[Ultra-Mobile PC|UMPC]] with 1GB of [[Random-access memory|RAM]]. For systems running [[Windows Defender]], MSE disables it completely as it is a superset of Defender's functionality.<ref>http://www.winsupersite.com/win7/mse_beta.asp</ref>
MSE is based on OneCare's technologies, essentially making it OneCare without the management features and other non-anti-malware functionality, albeit greatly streamlined and simplified. In addition, MSE has been optimized to run on low end hardware efficiently, such as a Celeron-based [[Ultra-Mobile PC|UMPC]] with 1GB of [[Random-access memory|RAM]]. For systems running [[Windows Defender]], MSE disables it completely as it is a superset of Defender's functionality.<ref>http://www.winsupersite.com/win7/mse_beta.asp</ref>
â
Amy Barzdukas, senior director of product management in the online services division at Microsoft, said: "This new, no-cost offering will give us the ability to protect an even greater number of consumers, especially in markets where the growth of new PC purchases is outpaced only by the growth of malware." <ref name="nocostsecuritypr" />
+
==Official release==
  +   +
A limited beta began on June 23, open only to 75,000 US, Israel & Brazil customers, with a Chinese beta opening in mid July, however, only one day later, (June 24, 2009), the downloads are no longer accessible, and the website displays a message saying "We are not accepting additional participants at this time"<ref>http://www.microsoft.com/security_essentials/</ref>. A final release expected no later than September.<ref>http://www.neowin.net/news/main/09/06/18/microsoft-set-to-beta-microsoft-security-essentials-june-23></ref>
